title: House Panel Votes to Recommend Holding Mark Meadows in Contempt
summary: Former Trump chief of staff was subpoenaed over activities related to Jan. 6 Capitol riot. WASHINGTON-The House panel investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol by supporters of former President Donald Trump voted to recommend holding his final chief of staff in criminal contempt of Congress for defying a congressional subpoena.

title: Kim Kardashian Says She Passed California's 'Baby Bar' Law Exam on Fourth Try
summary: Passing test gets reality TV star one step closer to becoming a practicing attorney. Kim Kardashian says she has passed the "baby bar" exam in California after her fourth try, bringing the reality TV star one step closer to being a practicing attorney in the state.

title: Boy Scouts Insurer Chubb to Pay $800 Million in Sex-Abuse Compensation Deal
summary: An agreement with Chubb's Century Indemnity would add to the funding available for sex-abuse victims under the Boy Scouts' chapter 11 restructuring plan. The Boy Scouts of America reached an $800 million settlement with Chubb Ltd. 's Century Indemnity Co. over childhood sexual abuse within the youth group, potentially boosting the funds available for abuse victims under its chapter 11 plan.

title: Supreme Court Says No Religious Exemption for N.Y. Health Workers
summary: Justices deny emergency requests over Covid-19 vaccinations, upholding lower-court ruling and echoing similar denial in Maine. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court turned down emergency requests by New York healthcare workers for a religious exemption from state requirements to vaccinate against Covid-19. A federal appeals court in New York previously denied the workers' requests.

title: Air Force Discharges 27 Airmen for Refusing Covid-19 Vaccine
summary: Roughly 97% of the active duty members of the Air Force and Space Force are vaccinated. The U.S. Air Force discharged 27 airmen for refusing to get a coronavirus vaccine, the Pentagon said Monday. They are among the first active duty service members to be removed for not meeting the mandate.

title: Hard Rock to Buy Mirage Casino on Las Vegas Strip for $1.1 Billion
summary: MGM Resorts selling operations of the property to focus on new business. Hard Rock International has agreed to buy the operations of the Mirage casino on the Las Vegas Strip from MGM Resorts International for nearly $1.1 billion with plans to build a giant guitar-shaped hotel on the glitzy boulevard.

title: The Internal Revenue Leak Service
summary: The tax agency still can't say how taxpayer files were stolen.. Democrats want to give $80 billion to the Internal Revenue Service to audit millions of Americans each year. Yet six months after the progressive website ProPublica first published the secret tax information of rich Americans, the tax agency still can't explain what happened. Senate Republicans led by Iowa's Chuck Grassley are demanding answers.

title: The Fleeing Young of Illinois
summary: Fiscal trouble looms for the state as its young adults flee.. Illinois lost one House seat in this year's reapportionment, and Democrats blame snowbirds migrating south. But a new analysis by the University of Illinois Extension finds that those fleeing for better tax and economic climes include swarms of young people.

title: Biden Sticks It to . . . Canada
summary: Ottawa says new EV subsidies violate the USMCA trade deal.. Canadians are known for their congeniality, at least by world diplomat standards. So it's worth noting that our neighbors to the north are becoming increasingly frustrated with the way President Biden and Democrats are treating them.

title: Yellen and the Global Tax Stall
summary: Other countries aren't following where Build Back Better would lead.. Amid the debate surrounding the Biden Administration's spending plans, it's easy to forget that the Build Back Better bill comes with hundreds of billions of dollars in tax increases. Democrats promise that, at least on corporate taxes, other countries will raise theirs, too. So lawmakers should know what Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen isn't telling them: Those global tax plans may yet stall out.

title: Data Management Software Firm Liqid Raises $100 Million to Expand
summary: Denver-based startup targets companies looking for cloudlike flexibility in their own data centers. Software startup Liqid Inc. raised $100 million last week in a Series C funding round to build out its concept of so-called composable information-technology infrastructure, an attempt to add cloudlike flexibility to customers relying on their own data centers.

title: California to Reinstate Indoor Mask Mandate
summary: Rule will apply for one month as case rates rise and officials worry about Christmas gatherings, Omicron variant. California will again require masking in all public indoor settings regardless of vaccination status as it confronts rising case rates ahead of the winter holidays and uncertainty about the Omicron variant.

title: Biden Will Pay a High Price for Bread and Circuses
summary: Voters aren't amused by Washington's political clown show, which is rapidly raising the cost of living.. When the Roman writer Juvenal penned the adage "bread and circuses," he warned emperors that they must conjure such distractions to pacify peasants into accepting lousy rulers. This should have President Biden worried-the price of bread in the U.S. has jumped 15% since the start of 2020, while a ticket to a modern-day circus, an NBA game, has climbed 37% since last season.

title: Don't Play Chicken With a Train
summary: Boyhood games on the tracks were dangerous but taught us valuable lessons.. In my hometown in the 1960s, my friends and I could have walked a standard route to reach our local high school. But we knew better. So we took a shortcut across the railroad tracks running through our New Jersey suburb.

title: Prison Reform Should Be a Bipartisan Issue
summary: America's correctional institutions are filthy, violent, overcrowded and lack all privacy.. I was happy to learn that Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene and several other members of Congress visited the District of Columbia Jail recently. And I was flattered that her ensuing report, "Unusually Cruel," quoted from my book and even borrowed its title. As someone who frequently visits prisons, I believe it is vital that people see firsthand the conditions of incarceration around the country-and realize the humanity of those behind bars.

title: Notable & Quotable: Elections
summary: 'The fact that Trump won all but one of these bellwether counties again, despite losing nationally, is impressive.'. From "The New Main Street Coalition" by Jeffrey H. Anderson in the Fall 2021 Claremont Review of Books:

title: Crisis in Ukraine Is a Winner for Putin
summary: He divides European and U.S. opinion, and Russians like that he's in the world spotlight.. Vladimir Putin is having a good crisis in Ukraine. True, the Russian army hasn't entered Kyiv, but Mr. Putin doesn't need to achieve his maximum objectives to put some points on the board. At minimal cost, the Russian president's Ukraine moves have increased his political standing and promoted his agenda at home.

title: Biden's 'Yes' to Racial Preferences
summary: The administration takes Harvard's side in a case involving Asian-Americans.. A week into his presidency, Joe Biden issued a memorandum declaring "the Federal Government has a responsibility to prevent racism, xenophobia, and intolerance against everyone in America, including Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders."

title: 'Green With Milk and Sugar' Review: When Japan Filled Our Teacups
summary: Green tea-not today's ubiquitous orange pekoe-dominated America's 'teaways' for nearly a century, from the 1860s through the early 1940s.. 'I have found that a surprising amount of history can becontained in a simple cup," Robert Hellyer writes in "Green With Milk and Sugar," his heady brew of the intertwined history of green tea in Japan, the United States and his own family.

title: Tornado Fatalities Rise as Search Efforts Continue
summary: Weekend storms cause catastrophic damage across broad section of the country. A total of 88 people have been confirmed dead in this weekend's tornadoes that tore through six states.

title: Log4j Software Vulnerability Expected to Persist, Possibly for Months
summary: Companies are rushing to spot the flaw on their computer networks and in vendors' technology. A flaw in a widely used piece of free internet software is prompting companies to rush to update their systems and prevent cyberattacks, but the technology's ubiquity means the threat could affect businesses for months, security researchers say.

title: Nassar Victims Reach $380 Million Settlement
summary: A judge said Monday she would approve the settlement after a five-year legal battle between gymnasts including stars and their sport's governing bodies. USA Gymnastics, U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee and their insurers have agreed to fund a $380 million settlement with victims of longtime national team physician Larry Nassar, drawing to a close a five-year legal battle that has upended American Olympic sports governance.

title: U.K. Sees First Death of a Person With Omicron
summary: Prime Minister Boris Johnson says rapid spread means people should set aside the idea that the variant is milder. LONDON-The U.K. reported its first death of a patient with Omicron on Monday, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said, as the country faces what he called a tidal wave of cases of the new variant.

title: Stocks Fall Ahead of Fed Decision This Week
summary: S&P 500, Dow industrials drop; vaccine makers surge on signs of demand for Covid-19 boosters. Stocks fell ahead of a major decision by the Federal Reserve expected later this week on how aggressively to combat inflation.

title: Peloton Strikes Back at 'Sex and the City' Reboot With New Ad
summary: Fitness company releases ad in response to plotline about Mr. Big in 'And Just Like That...'. Mr. Big from the "Sex and the City" reboot has come back to life, this time in a new Peloton Interactive Inc . ad.

title: Harley-Davidson's EV Division to Go Public Via SPAC Merger
summary: Merger gives LiveWire, the motorcycle maker's EV arm, an enterprise valuation of about $1.77 billion. Harley-Davidson Inc.'s electric-motorcycle division will become a separate publicly traded company via a blank-check merger, a move the company said would help accelerate product development and manufacturing.

title: GameStop, AMC Fall in Blow to Meme-Stock Investors
summary: Individual investors continued to buy the stocks amid last week's selloff, data show. Shares of GameStop Corp. and AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. tumbled Monday, dealing a blow to the legions of individual investors who have banded around the two stocks and frequently tout them on social media.

title: NatWest Fined $351 Million for Overlooking Money-Laundering Risks Posed By Client
summary: Cash deposits by gold dealer Fowler Oldfield arrived in black garbage bags bursting from the weight, according to sentencing remarks by a judge for London's Southwark Crown Court. A NatWest Group PLC subsidiary was fined £264.7 million, equivalent to $351.3 million, in a London court over anti-money-laundering offenses for its failure to follow-up on red flags associated with the cash deposits of a customer.

title: Canada Issues Apology for Turning Blind Eye to Military's Sexualized Culture
summary: Canada's government acknowledges it failed to heed warnings to fix military culture. OTTAWA-Canada on Monday issued a formal apology to former and current military members who were victims of sexual assault and sexual misconduct over decades, acknowledging the government's failure to eradicate a toxic culture that harmed and destroyed thousands of lives.

title: 'Keys' by Alicia Keys Review: Twice Isn't Always So Nice
summary: The star's eighth studio LP is a two-disc set that's both an original album and a collection of remixes..

title: Florida Home on the Water Trades for More Than $90 Million
summary: Located south of Palm Beach, the property was sold by hedge-fund founder Paul Saunders. A newly built, waterfront estate south of Palm Beach has sold for more than $90 million, according to people familiar with the deal.

title: Flash-Mob Thefts Planned on Snapchat and Other Apps, Police Say
summary: Suspects in recent crimes at Nordstrom, Best Buy and Louis Vuitton stores often don't know each other, making investigations difficult. SAN FRANCISCO-A recent rash of thefts by fast-moving mobs at stores in the Bay Area and outside Minneapolis were organized on social media and committed by people who often didn't know one another, according to law-enforcement officials investigating the incidents.

title: Lithium Prices Soar, Turbocharged By Electric-Vehicle Demand and Scant Supply
summary: Resume Subscription. Lithium prices are rising at their fastest pace in years, setting off a race to secure supplies and fueling worries about long-term shortages of a vital ingredient in the rechargeable batteries that power everything from electric vehicles to smartphones.

title: Watch Your Step (Tuesday Crossword, December 14)
U.S. Troops Won't Face Charges in Kabul Airstrike That Killed 10 Civilians
summary: Investigators, senior officers, Defense Secretary Austin conclude mistakes leading to airstrike weren't criminal. WASHINGTON-No one in the U.S. military will face criminal charges in connection with an airstrike in Kabul that killed 10 civilians in the last days of the U.S. war in Afghanistan, the Pentagon said Monday.

title: Geminid Meteor Shower 2021: How to Watch the Shooting Stars Tonight
summary: The Geminids return each December, providing one of the year's best and most reliable meteor showers. Skywatchers are getting set for the Geminid meteor shower, which this year peaks late tonight and early tomorrow morning.

title: 'Dr. Oz Show' to End as Host Preps for Senate Run
summary: Mehmet Oz has joined a crowded GOP primary in Pennsylvania. "The Dr. Oz Show" will end Jan. 14, Sony Pictures Television said Monday, weeks after host Mehmet Oz filed paperwork to run for Senate.

title: Omicron Oil Demand Impact Will Be 'Mild and Short-Lived,' OPEC Says
summary: Governments and businesses are now better adapted to handling Covid-19, cartel says. The Omicron variant's impact on global oil markets won't be as seismic as initially feared, because governments and businesses are now better adapted to dealing with the coronavirus, the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries said Monday.

title: Fear of Iran, Shrinking U.S. Role in Middle East Push Rivals Together
summary: Leaders of Israel and the United Arab Emirates meet amid flurry of diplomacy in region. The first-ever official meeting Monday between Israel's prime minister and the United Arab Emirates' de facto leader is the latest in a flurry of diplomacy reshaping the geopolitics of the Middle East amid fear that the Iran nuclear talks will collapse and worries over the shrinking U.S. role in the region.

title: Penguin Random House, Simon & Schuster Challenge Antitrust Lawsuit
summary: Publishers argue Justice Department challenge to their planned merger is baseless. WASHINGTON-Penguin Random House and Simon & Schuster filed their first court response Monday to a Justice Department antitrust lawsuit challenging their planned merger, arguing their deal would benefit authors, retailers and consumers.

title: JPMorgan in Talks to Pay $200 Million Fine Over Staffers' Texts
summary: Settlement would be first to emerge from regulatory sweep of how banks track workers' communications. JPMorgan Chase & Co. is nearing a deal to pay a $200 million fine and admit that it failed to properly monitor employees' messages, the first settlement to emerge from a regulatory sweep into how banks oversee traders' chats.

title: Apple's iOS Update Offers New iPhone Features for Kids, Music and Digital Afterlife
summary: Now available are a voice-only Apple Music plan, tools to protect children and a way to share your iCloud files after you die. Apple released its latest software update, iOS 15.2, on Monday, bringing with it a new Apple Music plan, more safety and privacy tools and other enhancements.

title: The Best Theater of 2021: The Curtain Goes Up Again
summary: After Covid-19 threatened the world of theater, this year saw in-person events re-emerge with renewed vigor and urgency.. In July, I resumed reviewing live theater after a protracted pandemic-related hiatus. First came a string of outdoor performances in New England. Then Broadway reopened in August, and the 2021-22 season got under way in earnest two months later. Now shows are opening on and off Broadway with gratifying regularity, all in front of masked audiences, though there's no telling whether the spread of the new Omicron Covid-19 variant will shut down America's theaters in weeks to come.

title: As Turkey's Currency Collapses, Erdogan's Support Sinks Even in His Hometown
summary: Resume Subscription. RIZE, Turkey-Here in President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's hometown on Turkey's Black Sea coast, residents are questioning the leadership of their city's favorite son amid an economic crisis that is driving up the cost of food, gasoline and medicine.

title: How a $6 Bass Pro Shops Hat Became a Fashion Trend
summary: You don't need to fish to wear this hat, in fact many of its fans have never touched a fishing pole; "you can throw it on with anything". Jesse Alvarado doesn't fish or hunt, and he wouldn't describe himself as an outdoorsy person. But on many mornings, Mr. Alvarado, 25, a restaurant worker in Los Angeles, plops a Bass Pro Shops trucker hat on his head.

title: Golden Globes 2022: 'Succession,' 'The Power of the Dog' Among Most Nominated
summary: The show will go on-just not in a live broadcast-after a year when the awards' organizers faced criticism over representations and ethics. The Golden Globe nominations, announced Monday, showed "Succession," "The Morning Show" and "Ted Lasso" leading the TV side and the quiet dramas "Belfast" and "The Power of the Dog" dominating for film.

title: China Reports First Omicron Case in the Mainland
summary: The infection was discovered in a traveler who arrived in the port city of Tianjin from overseas last week. Chinese authorities in the northern port city of Tianjin said they had detected the mainland's first case of the Omicron coronavirus variant, putting what China has called its "zero tolerance" Covid-19 strategy to a further test.

title: The Biden Stagflation Is Coming
summary: His approach to the economy is already causing prices to rise. It will soon stifle growth as well.. The White House continues to insist that inflation will soon fade away and the country will return to its pre-pandemic prosperity. But the Biden administration's regulatory agenda virtually ensures that the post-pandemic economy will be nothing like it was before. The mounting regulatory burden of Mr. Biden's executive orders, his regulators' open hostility toward America's economic system, and the return to Progressive-era antitrust enforcement will stifle growth. All the ingredients will be present to turn the current inflation into stagflation.

title: Biden Seems Set on Making 'Transitory' Inflation Last
summary: He wants to feed demand while hoping workers get squeezed to avoid a 1970s-style wage-price spiral.. Perhaps we shouldn't be too hard on President Biden and Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell for insisting for months that inflation would be "transitory."

title: Chevron and the Murky Politics of Deference
summary: Does the court's approach depend on which branch of government Republicans control more often?. While I agree with Richard Epstein and Mario Loyola that Chevron v. Natural Resources Defense Council (1984) was "disastrously wrong" ("The Supreme Court's Chance to Rein In the Regulatory State," op-ed Dec. 8), the court's current inclination to depart from that decision may contribute to the perception that the court is too political.

title: Faulty Diplomatic Assumptions Beget Failure
summary: The Biden administration thought the main threat to world stability was Donald Trump.. The editorial board is right to point out that U.S. strategy under President Biden is unbalanced ("Rogues Are on the March," Dec. 6). There are those who believe diplomacy is the way to peace. That makes sense in the cases of the U.S., the European Union, Japan, and so forth. But it is deeply mistaken when it comes to China, Russia, Iran and others.

title: New Inflation Stats Vindicate a Bold Prediction
summary: John Greenwood and Steve Hanke got it right.. Five months ago, John Greenwood and Steve Hanke's op-ed "Too Much Money Portends High Inflation" (July 21) made an unusual prediction: They specified a data range and a time. Most prognosticators, trying to make it hard to prove them wrong, are careful not to do both. Messrs. Greenwood and Hanke were bolder. They predicted that "by the end of the year, the year-over-year inflation rate will be at least 6% and possibly as high as 9%."

title: China Still Lacks the Qualitative Edge in Tech
summary: Its college-educated engineers were the equivalent of senior technicians in America.. Graham Allison and Eric Schmidt make cogent points in "China Will Soon Lead the U.S. in Tech" (op-ed, Dec. 8), but they focus mainly on quantitative, not qualitative factors. Their evaluation implies that, for example, the number of 5G base stations installed by the Chinese (for a much larger population) represents an advantage in cellular technology.

title: What Religious Schools Can Learn From Planned Parenthood
summary: Sometimes receiving government funds requires sustaining a convenient fiction.. In "Religious Schools and the Constitution" (Review & Outlook, Dec. 8), the editorial board argues that academic and religious training cannot be separated in religious schools. Is that correct? Planned Parenthood receives large government subsidies by maintaining the fiction that the government money is not used for abortion. Since the schools can raise money apart from the government subsidy payments, why not create the fiction that all the religious training will be paid for privately?

title: Top-Notch Dudes
summary: The White House announces three remarkable heroes will receive the Medal of Honor.. At last, there's good news from the White House, contained in a Friday press release:

title: Canada Renews Central Bank's Inflation-Targeting Mandate
summary: Agreement with Bank of Canada to target 2% CPI also promotes central bank's role in attaining full employment. OTTAWA-The Canadian government and Bank of Canada agreed Monday to renew the central bank's mandate to target 2% annual inflation, with an emphasis on giving the central bank flexibility to address economic challenges and help obtain full employment when conditions warrant.

title: Pfizer to Acquire Arena Pharmaceuticals in $6.7 Billion Deal
summary: The cash agreement would add a promising bowel-disease treatment to its pipeline. Pfizer Inc. agreed to acquire Arena Pharmaceuticals Inc. for $6.7 billion, bolstering the pharmaceutical giant's pipeline of medicines for inflammatory bowel diseases.

title: UBS Should Pay Its $2 Billion Fine and Move On
summary: Swiss bank has an affordable opportunity to draw a line under its French tax evasion case. It should take it.. UBS has lost its appeal against a French tax evasion charge, but won the chance to affordably dispel one of the few clouds still hanging over its stock.

title: Money-Losing Virgin Atlantic Aims for a Pandemic Reboot
summary: Resume Subscription. LONDON-For most of the travel industry, the pandemic has been an existential challenge. For Virgin Atlantic Airways, it was an opportunity.

title: For a Taliban-Ruled Afghanistan, and the Rest of the World, a Crisis Looms
summary: Resume Subscription. Afghanistan is heading into one of its most difficult years.

title: How People Can Make Smarter-and Healthier-Social-Media Choices
summary: Is the problem us or the platforms? Brian Primack, a professor of public health and medicine, says it's both.. It has become increasingly clear this past year that social media isn't always healthy for people.

title: This Was the Year Investors and Businesses Put Big Bets on Climate
summary: A lot of individuals, institutional investors and companies hope to profit from reducing emissions. At the Glasgow climate summit in November, more than 140 countries announced goals to reach net zero greenhouse-gas emissions by 2050.

title: Parthenon Capital to Buy Kroll Bond Rating Agency in $900 Million Deal
summary: While sales of credit-ratings firms are relatively uncommon, this is the second in recent years. Private-equity firm Parthenon Capital Partners has agreed to buy a majority stake in Kroll Bond Rating Agency LLC, in a rare instance of a credit-ratings firm changing hands.

title: Urban Meyer Stares Into the NFL Abyss
summary: A celebrated college coach is having a pro debut to forget.. Does anyone care about the sullen travails of a 2-11 professional football team?

title: UBS Penalties Slashed by Around $3 Billion in French Tax Case
summary: Court upholds Swiss bank's conviction in tax evasion case but cuts penalty. A French appeals court ordered UBS Group AG to pay around $2 billion for helping wealthy clients in France evade taxes, reducing the size of an earlier penalty of around $5 billion.

title: Arena, Harley-Davidson, Bluebird Bio, Peloton: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
summary: Pfizer said it is acquiring Arena Pharmaceuticals; Harley-Davidson's EV division is going public via a SPAC. Wall Street stock indexes opened with mild losses after the S&P 500 hit a record close on the heels of inflation figures that were the highest in decades. Here's what we're watching in Monday's trading:

title: Muddled Priorities and Monetary Policy in Beijing
summary: China has significant scope to fight off downturn-if it is willing to be realistic about what is needed. Every year China's top leadership gets together and hashes out economic priorities for the coming 12 months at the Central Economic Work Conference. The communiqué from this year's conference, which wrapped up on Friday, was unusually explicit: the terms "stable," "steady" or "stabilize" were mentioned roughly twice as many times as last year.

title: Shareholders Press Facebook for Governance Changes
summary: Investor group seeks board oversight of efforts to reduce harmful content and repeats its call for independent chairman. Facebook is facing more calls from shareholders to address harm on its platforms and overall governance as the company, now known as Meta Platforms Inc., responds to pressure from lawmakers and others.

title: Global Central Banks Diverge as Omicron Clouds Growth, Inflation Outlook
summary: Central banks in the U.S., the U.K. and the eurozone set to provide guidance this week on future interest rates. FRANKFURT-The policy paths of the world's major central banks are diverging sharply, creating crosswinds for investors, as the Omicron variant of Covid-19 clouds an already uneven global recovery and risks aggravating red-hot inflation.

title: I Gave My Mom a Crypto Wallet: A Simple Guide to NFTs, Blockchain and More
summary: If you wince when you hear the term 'nonfungible token,' fear not. We created an NFT to help explain this whole crypto revolution in a clear, easy-to-understand way.. Happy holidays, Mom!

title: UPS, Postal Service Step Up On-Time Holiday Deliveries
summary: Industry analysts say consumers shopping earlier this holiday season and more in-store purchases have helped carriers. Delivery networks have mostly held up during the first major test of the peak shipping season, industry data show, as earlier shopping and increased in-store purchases have eased the usual late-year congestion.

title: Kate Hudson Gets a Lot of Energy From Intermittent Fasting
summary: "You don't realize until you start doing that how much your body needs to be able to digest what we've eaten. Anywhere from 14 to 16 hours is usually the break I give my body.". In our series My Monday Morning, self-motivated people tell WSJ. how they start off the week.

title: To Fight the Global Covid-19 Pandemic, We Need a Global Game Plan
summary: Resume Subscription. For many months in 2020, Covid-19 was the No. 1 cause of death in the U.S. And deaths this year have already surpassed last year.

title: After Two Decades, Abuse Crisis Has Humbled the Catholic Church
summary: Scandals over clerical abuse of minors have left the institution poorer and less influential. ROME-From when the Catholic Church's sex-abuse crisis erupted in 2002 until his death more than three years later, St. John Paul II never met with a victim of clerical sexual abuse.

title: India Investigates Hacking of Modi's Twitter Account
summary: A fake tweet that said India was adopting bitcoin came as the government is considering ways to prohibit cryptocurrencies. NEW DELHI-Indian officials are investigating how Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Twitter account was hacked, with a tweet to his more than 73 million followers falsely saying India was adopting bitcoin as legal tender and distributing it to people in the country.

title: Crypto Venture Funds Look for an Edge in a Crowded Market
summary: In crypto, smaller funds are specializing by sector, stage and the services they can offer to entrepreneurs. Smaller venture funds are finding their own niche in the growing crypto market.

title: Tech Companies Bring Back the Human Touch
summary: From online dating to social media, algorithms are getting more assistance from humans. Maybe algorithms can't solve most of our problems. This year, developments in social media have taught us that some can even create them. Lately, online technology companies are experimenting with a more human touch.

title: China's Quest for Space Power Starts With Moon Dust
summary: Resume Subscription. HONG KONG-Nestled in 3.82 pounds of moon soil is what China hopes could be the answer to fueling its future.

title: Hospitals Drop Staff Vaccine Mandates Amid Labor Crunch
summary: After a judge halted a Biden administration mandate for healthcare workers to get vaccinated, employers including HCA and Tenet have removed the requirement. Some of the largest U.S. hospital systems have dropped Covid-19 vaccine mandates for staff after a federal judge temporarily halted a Biden administration mandate that healthcare workers get the shots.

title: Baseball's Labor Showdown Won't Solve the Problems Fans Care About
summary: Talks for a new labor contract aren't expected to include possible rule changes to make baseball more appealing and bolster its fan base.. Major League Baseball commissioner Rob Manfred was clear last spring that the sport's pending labor negotiations would prominently feature a topic important to many fans: discussing rule changes to make the game less plodding and more watchable.

title: Tornado Left Deadly Path of Destruction up to 250 Miles Long in Six States
summary: Number of victims expected to climb, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear says. Tornadoes that ripped through six states over the weekend killed scores of people, leveled entire towns and left recovery teams facing weeks of clearing rubble, as scientists tallied what may be once-in-a-century levels of destruction on a path up to 250 miles long.

title: Credit Suisse Fills Leadership Slots in Post-Archegos Reshuffle
summary: Swiss banking giant rehires Francesco De Ferrari to run wealth management. Credit Suisse Group AG rehired Francesco De Ferrari to head its wealth-management arm catering to the world's rich, putting the veteran banker in charge of a broader revamp to make the business bigger and safer.

title: When Companies Fire Their Auditors, Timing Is Clue to Future Trouble
summary: Study shows that when auditors are fired late in the year, accounting problems are more likely. When a company and its auditor split up, it can be a sign of trouble in the books. But the two sides typically don't give a reason for the breakup.

title: SEC Lures Top Enforcer Who Says Tougher Punishment Is Coming
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-The Securities and Exchange Commission often picks its top cop from the ranks of Wall Street's best defense lawyers. Its newest one hadn't worked on a securities case in almost six years until he took on the job in July.

title: Why U.S. Job Gains Are So Hard to Count During Covid
summary: Government gets less data from employers, and economists have a difficult time understanding how the pandemic affects consumer, business behavior. The monthly U.S. jobs report moves trillions of dollars in market trades and influences key policy decisions such as the Federal Reserve's interest-rate plans.

title: Consumer Finance Startup Dave Eyes Acquisitions, Crypto After SPAC Deal
summary: The company expects its special-purpose acquisition merger to close in coming weeks. Personal-finance startup Dave Inc. plans to use the roughly $450 million from its coming public listing for acquisitions, new products and possible investments in cryptocurrency.

title: Ares Raises $8 Billion Fund in Private-Credit Arms Race
summary: High returns are attracting debt investors to direct loans that cut out Wall Street. Ares Management Corp. has raised $8 billion dollars for a fund making direct loans to small and midsize U.S. companies, escalating a fight between alternative-asset managers for market share in the burgeoning private-credit market.

title: China's SenseTime Postpones IPO After U.S. Blacklisting
summary: AI company, which had aimed to raise up to $767 million from the deal, says it is still committed to concluding Hong Kong listing soon. Chinese artificial-intelligence company SenseTime Group Inc. said it would postpone its Hong Kong initial public offering, days after it was added to an investment blacklist of companies that the U.S. government says are supporting Chinese military development.

title: Up for Grabs (Monday Crossword, December 13)
Australia Steps Up Military Overhaul With Korea Arms Deal
summary: U.S. ally to buy 30 self-propelled howitzers, 15 armored ammunition-resupply vehicles and weapon-locating radars. SYDNEY-Australia signed a contract worth about $717 million to buy self-propelled howitzers from South Korea, broadening its military cooperation as it seeks to counter China's influence in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: How to Tell the Boss You're Burned Out (Without Derailing Your Career)
summary: We're sharing more at work these days, but it can be risky to confess to being overwhelmed. Here's how and when to speak up.. You're burned out at work. Does your manager need to know?
